snippet: On Tuesday, voters will take the first big step toward choosing a successor to Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg.
abstract: New York City’s long and tumultuous mayoral primary campaign hurtles to an end, as voters prepare to take first big step toward choosing successor to Mayor Michael R Bloomberg; contest has increasingly turned on crucial elements of Bloomberg's legacy on public safety and income inequality, but despite widely publicized free-for-all among multiple candidates, fewer than one in four Democrats and Republicans are expected to vote in party primaries.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David W. Chen, Javier C. Hernández, Thomas Kaplan, Nate Schweber, Kate Taylor and Julie Turkewitz.

lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, voters will take the first big step toward choosing a successor to Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg.

headline.main: Long, Stormy Mayoral Primary Hurtles to Finish
headline.print_headline: Long, Stormy Mayoral Race Hurtles to Finish
